node_2: uwe boll's most expensive film production to date
edge: The production budget for the movie was $60 million, making it Uwe Boll's most expensive film production to date.
The first version of the movie will run for 127 minutes and is being released in cinemas.
A second, director's cut version of the movie was made specifically for DVD release and runs for 155 minutes.
Parts of the movie were shot near Robert Burnaby Park.
The production of the movie took place near the Municipality of Sooke.
Locals and First Nations people from the Greater Victoria, Capital Regional District (CRD) were recruited for various roles in the movie.
Companies including Elektrofilm added visual effects during post-production.
Companies including Frantic Films added visual effects during post-production.
Companies including The Orphanage added visual effects during post-production.
Companies including PICTORION das werk added visual effects during post-production.
Companies including Rocket Science VFX added visual effects during post-production.
Companies including TVT postproduction added visual effects during post-production.
Companies including upstart! Animation added visual effects during post-production.
